verses.text: And Elisha the prophet called one of the children of the prophets, and said unto him, Gird up thy loins, and take this box of oil in thine hand, and go \add to\add* Ramoth-gilead:
and when thou comest thither, look out there Jehu the son of Jehoshaphat the son of Nimshi, and go in, and make him arise up from among his brethren, and carry him \add to\add* an inner chamber:
then take the box of oil, and pour \add it\add* on his head, and say, Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc*, I have anointed thee king over Israel. Then open the door, and flee, and tarry not.
So the young man, \add even\add* the young man the prophet, went \add to\add* Ramoth-gilead.
And when he came, behold, the captains of the host \add were\add* sitting; and he said, I have an errand to thee, O captain. And Jehu said, Unto which of all us? And he said, To thee, O captain.

And he arose, and went into the house; and he poured the oil on his head, and said unto him, Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc* God of Israel, I have anointed thee king over the people of the \sc Lord\sc*, \add even\add* over Israel.
And thou shalt smite the house of Ahab thy master, that I may avenge the blood of my servants the prophets, and the blood of all the servants of the \sc Lord\sc*, at the hand of Jezebel.
For the whole house of Ahab shall perish: and I will cut off from Ahab \add him that\add* pisseth against the wall, and \add him that is\add* shut up and left in Israel:
and I will make the house of Ahab like the house of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, and like the house of Baasha the son of Ahijah:
and the dogs shall eat Jezebel in the portion of Jezreel, and \add there shall be\add* none to bury \add her\add*. And he opened the door, and fled.

Then Jehu came forth to the servants of his lord: and \add one\add* said unto him, \add Is all\add* well? wherefore came this mad \add fellow\add* to thee? And he said unto them, Ye know the man, and his communication.
And they said, \add It is\add* false; tell us now. And he said, Thus and thus spake he to me, saying, Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc*, I have anointed thee king over Israel.
Then they hasted, and took every man his garment, and put \add it\add* under him on the top of the stairs, and blew with trumpets, saying, Jehu is king.
So Jehu the son of Jehoshaphat the son of Nimshi conspired against Joram. (Now Joram had kept Ramoth-gilead, he and all Israel, because of Hazael king of Syria.

But king Joram was returned to be healed in Jezreel of the wounds which the Syrians had given him, when he fought with Hazael king of Syria.) And Jehu said, If it be your minds, \add then\add* let none go forth \add nor\add* escape out of the city to go to tell \add it\add* in Jezreel.
So Jehu rode \add in a chariot\add*, and went to Jezreel; for Joram lay there. And Ahaziah king of Judah was come down to see Joram.

And there stood a watchman on the tower in Jezreel, and he spied the company of Jehu as he came, and said, I see a company. And Joram said, Take a horseman, and send to meet them, and let him say, \add Is it\add* peace?

So there went one on horseback to meet him, and said, Thus saith the king, \add Is it\add* peace? And Jehu said, What hast thou to do with peace? turn thee behind me. And the watchman told, saying, The messenger came to them, but he cometh not again.
Then he sent \add out\add* a second on horseback, which came to them, and said, Thus saith the king, \add Is it\add* peace? And Jehu answered, What hast thou to do with peace? turn thee behind me.
And the watchman told, saying, He came even unto them, and cometh not again: and the driving \add is\add* like the driving of Jehu the son of Nimshi; for he driveth furiously.

And Joram said, Make ready. And his chariot was made ready. And Joram king of Israel and Ahaziah king of Judah went out, each in his chariot, and they went out against Jehu, and met him in the portion of Naboth the Jezreelite.

And it came to pass, when Joram saw Jehu, that he said, \add Is it\add* peace, Jehu? And he answered, What peace, so long as the whoredoms of thy mother Jezebel and her witchcrafts \add are so\add* many?
And Joram turned his hands, and fled, and said to Ahaziah, \add There is\add* treachery, O Ahaziah.
And Jehu drew a bow with his full strength, and smote Jehoram between his arms, and the arrow went out at his heart, and he sunk down in his chariot.

Then said \add Jehu\add* to Bidkar his captain, Take up, \add and\add* cast him in the portion of the field of Naboth the Jezreelite: for remember how that, when I and thou rode together after Ahab his father, the \sc Lord\sc* laid this burden upon him;

surely I have seen yesterday the blood of Naboth, and the blood of his sons, saith the \sc Lord\sc*; and I will requite thee in this plat, saith the \sc Lord\sc*. Now therefore take \add and\add* cast him into the plat \add of ground\add*, according to the word of the \sc Lord\sc*.

But when Ahaziah the king of Judah saw \add this\add*, he fled \add by\add* the way of the garden house. And Jehu followed after him, and said, Smite him also in the chariot. \add And they did so\add* at the going up to Gur, which \add is\add* by Ibleam. And he fled \add to\add* Megiddo, and died there.
And his servants carried him \add in a chariot\add* to Jerusalem, and buried him in his sepulchre with his fathers in the city of David.
And in the eleventh year of Joram the son of Ahab \add began\add* Ahaziah to reign over Judah.
And when Jehu was come to Jezreel, Jezebel heard \add of it;\add* and she painted her face, and tired her head, and looked out at a window.
And as Jehu entered in at the gate, she said, \add Had\add* Zimri peace, who slew his master?
And he lift up his face to the window, and said, Who \add is\add* on my side? who? And there looked out to him two \add or\add* three eunuchs.
And he said, Throw her down. So they threw her down: and \add some\add* of her blood was sprinkled on the wall, and on the horses: and he trode her under foot.
And when he was come in, he did eat and drink, and said, Go, see now this cursed \add woman\add*, and bury her: for she \add is\add* a kingâ€™s daughter.
And they went to bury her: but they found no more of her than the skull, and the feet, and the palms of \add her\add* hands.

Wherefore they came again, and told him. And he said, This \add is\add* the word of the \sc Lord\sc*, which he spake by his servant Elijah the Tishbite, saying, In the portion of Jezreel shall dogs eat the flesh of Jezebel:
and the carcase of Jezebel shall be as dung upon the face of the field in the portion of Jezreel; \add so\add* that they shall not say, This \add is\add* Jezebel.
